class.name: SteamMultiplayerPeer
class.brief_description: Provides a bridge between Steam Networking Sockets and Godot's high level [MultiplayerAPI].
class.description: A [MultiplayerPeer] implementation that connects Steam Networking Sockets to Godot's high level multiplayer API. Should be passed to [MultiplayerAPI].multiplayer_peer after being initialized by calling [code]create_lobby[/code] or [code]connect_lobby[/code].

link.title: GodotSteam and SteamMultiplayerPeer - article by Michael Macha

method.name: add_peer
method.description: Creates a connection with a new peer. Runs [method Steam.connectP2P] under the hood. Returns [constant OK] upon success; otherwise, [constant ERR_CANT_CREATE] if the underlying P2P connection fails.

method.name: connect_to_lobby
method.description: Checks you are in the lobby by calling [method Steam.getLobbyOwner] or prints an error [constant ERR_CANT_CREATE]. It then calls [method SteamMultiplayerPeer.create_client] for the host or prints an [enum Error] enum if there is no host found. Finally it connects to the rest of the members of the lobby, calling add_peer for each. Returns [constant OK] upon success; otherwise, [constant ERR_ALREADY_IN_USE] if [b]connection_status[/b] is not [constant MultiplayerPeer.CONNECTION_DISCONNECTED].

method.name: create_client
method.description: On success, this sets server to [code]false[/code] and [b]unique_id[/b] to a newly generated unique ID. It then creates a listen socket with [method Steam.createListenSocketP2P] and a poll group with [method Steam.createPollGroup] under-the-hood. It then calls add_peer with the host [param steam_id] and [param virtual_port]. Finally it sets [b]set_refuse_new_connections[/b] to [code]false[/code] and [b]connection_status[/b] to [constant MultiplayerPeer.CONNECTION_CONNECTING].

method.name: create_host
method.description: On success, this sets server to true and [b]unique_id[/b] to 1. It then creates a listen socket with [method Steam.createListenSocketP2P] and a poll group with [method Steam.createPollGroup] under-the-hood. Finally it sets [b]set_refuse_new_connections[/b] to [code]false[/code] and [b]connection_status[/b] to [constant MultiplayerPeer.CONNECTION_CONNECTED]. Returns [enum OK] upon success; otherwise, [enum ERR_ALREADY_IN_USE] if [b]connection_status[/b] is not [constant MultiplayerPeer.CONNECTION_DISCONNECTED].

method.name: get_peer
method.description: Returns a [SteamPacketPeer] [RefCounted] object on success; otherwise, null.

method.name: get_peer_id_for_steam_id
method.description: Returns the peer ID on success or the [b]unique_id[b] if passing the local user's Steam ID; otherwise, 0.

method.name: get_steam_id_for_peer_id
method.description: Returns the Steam ID on success or the local user's Steam ID if passing the [b]unique_id[/b]; otherwise, 0.

method.name: host_with_lobby
method.description: You must have created a lobby with [method Steam.createLobby] prior to calling this. If you use a [param lobby_id] you are not the owner of, this will error with [enum ERR_CANT_CREATE]. Sets [b]tracked_lobby[/b] to this lobby on success. It then calls [method SteamMultiplayerPeer.create_host] and [method SteamMultiplayerPeer.add_peer] for all lobby members.
